abstract.p: Russian government suspends decision to seize frequencies of country's biggest mobile phone providers Vimpelcom and Mobile Telesystem, move investors say shows government has not lost sight of protecting property rights (S)

block.p: The Russian government suspended a decision to seize frequencies of the country's two biggest mobile phone providers in a move investors said showed the government had not lost sight of protecting property rights. The two companies, Vimpelcom and Mobile Telesystems, were told last week by the Ministry of Telecommunications to relinquish frequencies they had already been awarded; the action drove their stock prices down as much as 24 percent. Though the government did not explain why it had recalled the frequencies, analysts said Moscow's third mobile phone provider, Sonic Duo, which is owned partly by a government-controlled company, would have been the most likely recipient.

The Russian government suspended a decision to seize frequencies of the country's two biggest mobile phone providers in a move investors said showed the government had not lost sight of protecting property rights. The two companies, Vimpelcom and Mobile Telesystems, were told last week by the Ministry of Telecommunications to relinquish frequencies they had already been awarded; the action drove their stock prices down as much as 24 percent. Though the government did not explain why it had recalled the frequencies, analysts said Moscow's third mobile phone provider, Sonic Duo, which is owned partly by a government-controlled company, would have been the most likely recipient.
